aspects.name: Zoom Meetings
aspects.description: The core video conferencing service for real-time collaboration and communication within the Zoom Workplace ecosystem. It enables users to host and join virtual meetings with HD video and audio, share content, and use various interactive tools to facilitate communication and productivity for teams of any size.

sub_themes.name: Appreciation of Versatility Across Use Cases

themes.name: Perception That Zoom Meetings Lack Modern Features
Frequent Requests for Guidance on Using Zoom Meetings

aspects.name: Zoom Team Chat
aspects.description: A persistent messaging platform integrated within Zoom that enables teams to communicate asynchronously. It provides direct messaging, group channels, and the ability to share files, making it a central hub for team collaboration outside of meetings.

themes.name: Overall Appreciation for Zoom Team Chat

aspects.name: Zoom Phone
aspects.description: A cloud-based phone system that replaces traditional PBX systems. It offers enterprise-grade voice services including inbound/outbound calling, voicemail, call recording, and integrations with the broader Zoom platform for a unified communications experience.

aspects.name: Zoom Webinars
aspects.description: A platform for hosting large-scale, broadcast-style virtual events. Webinars allow a few speakers to present to a large audience with features like registration, Q&A, polling, and analytics, designed for one-to-many communication.

aspects.name: Zoom Events
aspects.description: An all-in-one solution for hosting multi-session, multi-day virtual and hybrid events. It extends Webinars with capabilities like event hubs, expo floors, networking lounges, and ticketing to create comprehensive event experiences.

aspects.name: Zoom Whiteboard
aspects.description: A digital canvas for visual collaboration that can be used during or outside of meetings. It provides tools for drawing, adding sticky notes, and brainstorming, enabling teams to ideate and capture information visually.

aspects.name: Zoom Rooms
aspects.description: A software-based room system that transforms physical meeting spaces into Zoom-enabled rooms. It provides a seamless experience for joining meetings from conference rooms with one-touch to join, wireless content sharing, and room controls.

aspects.name: Zoom Contact Center
aspects.description: An omnichannel cloud contact center solution that enables businesses to provide customer support across voice, video, chat, and SMS channels. It includes intelligent routing, agent management, and AI-powered tools to enhance customer service operations.

aspects.name: Revenue Accelerator
aspects.description: A conversation intelligence solution that uses AI to analyze sales calls and meetings. It provides insights, coaching recommendations, and deal tracking to help sales teams improve performance and close deals faster.

aspects.name: Zoom Scheduler
aspects.description: A scheduling tool that allows users to share their availability and let others book time with them. It integrates with calendars and Zoom Meetings to streamline the process of setting up appointments and eliminating scheduling conflicts.

aspects.name: Zoom Docs
aspects.description: A collaborative document creation tool that allows teams to create, edit, and share documents in real-time. It integrates with Zoom Meetings and AI features to enhance productivity and knowledge management.

aspects.name: Zoom Clips
aspects.description: A short-form video messaging tool that allows users to record and share video messages asynchronously. It enables screen and camera recording with editing capabilities for quick communication without scheduling a meeting.

aspects.name: Zoom Tasks
aspects.description: A task management feature integrated within Zoom that helps users track action items and to-dos. It connects with meetings and chat to capture and organize tasks for better productivity.

aspects.name: Account Administration
aspects.description: Tools and settings for managing a Zoom account at the organizational level. This includes user management, security settings, billing, and compliance features for IT administrators.

aspects.name: Platform & Integrations
aspects.description: The ecosystem of third-party apps, APIs, and integrations that extend Zoom's functionality. This includes the Zoom App Marketplace and developer tools for building custom integrations.

aspects.name: Usability
aspects.description: Cross-cutting concerns related to the overall user experience of Zoom products. This covers general ease of use, interface design, accessibility, and user onboarding across all Zoom applications.

l2_aspects.name: Scheduling & Joining
l2_aspects.description: Features related to creating, managing, and accessing meetings. This area covers everything from setting up a one-time call to managing complex recurring meetings with registration, ensuring a seamless start to any collaborative session.

l2_aspects.name: In-Meeting Experience
l2_aspects.description: Features and interactions that occur during a live meeting session. This encompasses all the tools participants use to communicate, collaborate, and engage, from video and audio controls to chat and interactive features.

l2_aspects.name: Audio Management
l2_aspects.description: Capabilities related to audio quality, control, and enhancement, ensuring participants can be heard clearly.

l2_aspects.name: Video Management
l2_aspects.description: Capabilities related to video quality, control, and enhancement, ensuring that participants can be seen clearly and customize their appearance.

l2_aspects.name: Recording & Transcription
l2_aspects.description: Features for capturing meeting content for later review. This includes local and cloud recording options, as well as AI-powered transcription and smart chapter features.

l2_aspects.name: Channels & Groups
l2_aspects.description: Organizational structures within Team Chat for grouping conversations by topic, project, or team. Channels can be public or private and support threaded conversations.

l2_aspects.name: Direct Messaging
l2_aspects.description: One-on-one or small group private conversations within Team Chat. Direct messages provide a quick way to communicate with specific individuals without creating a channel.

l2_aspects.name: File Sharing
l2_aspects.description: The ability to share files, images, and documents within Team Chat conversations. This includes previewing files and integrations with cloud storage services.

l2_aspects.name: Call Management
l2_aspects.description: Features for handling inbound and outbound calls, including call transfer, hold, park, and forwarding. This area covers the day-to-day operations of using Zoom Phone.

l2_aspects.name: Voicemail & Messages
l2_aspects.description: Features for receiving, managing, and responding to voicemail messages. This includes voicemail transcription and notification settings.

l2_aspects.name: Webinar Setup
l2_aspects.description: Tools for configuring and customizing webinar settings before the event. This includes registration, branding, and panelist management.

l2_aspects.name: Audience Engagement
l2_aspects.description: Interactive features that allow hosts to engage with webinar attendees, including Q&A, polling, and chat functionality.

l2_aspects.name: Event Setup & Configuration
l2_aspects.description: Tools for building and customizing the entire event experience from the ground up. This includes creating the event hub, designing the schedule, and setting up ticketing and registration for attendees.

l2_aspects.name: Canvas & Content Tools
l2_aspects.description: The core set of tools for adding and manipulating content on the whiteboard. These are the fundamental building blocks that users interact with to visualize ideas and structure information.

l2_aspects.name: Room System & Hardware
l2_aspects.description: The core components and certified hardware that make up a Zoom Room, including displays, controllers, cameras, and audio devices.

l2_aspects.name: Omnichannel Engagement
l2_aspects.description: Support for various communication channels including voice, video, chat, and SMS, allowing agents to interact with customers on their preferred platform.

l2_aspects.name: Conversation Analysis
l2_aspects.description: AI-powered tools to review and analyze recorded conversations from Zoom Meetings and Phone.

l2_aspects.name: Booking Schedules
l2_aspects.description: The core functionality for creating different types of schedulable appointment slots. This area covers the various configurations hosts can use to offer their availability to others for different scenarios, from one-on-one meetings to group sessions.

l2_aspects.name: Document Creation & Editing
l2_aspects.description: The core features for creating and formatting content within a Zoom Doc. This includes a rich text editor and the ability to embed various types of media and structural elements to build dynamic documents.

l2_aspects.name: Clip Creation & Editing
l2_aspects.description: The end-to-end workflow for producing a video clip. This includes recording the screen and/or camera, making basic edits, and preparing the clip for sharing.

l2_aspects.name: Task Management
l2_aspects.description: Core features for creating, organizing, and tracking tasks. This area covers the tools users interact with to manage their personal and team to-do lists.

l2_aspects.name: Cross-Product Integration
l2_aspects.description: Features that enable seamless workflows and data sharing between different Zoom products.

l2_aspects.name: User Management
l2_aspects.description: Tools for adding, removing, and managing users within a Zoom account. This includes role assignment, group management, and user provisioning.

l2_aspects.name: Security & Compliance
l2_aspects.description: Settings and features related to account security, data protection, and regulatory compliance requirements.

l3_aspects.name: Schedule a Meeting
l3_aspects.description: The fundamental capability to set up a future Zoom meeting. This includes defining the meeting topic, date, time, and duration, as well as configuring basic security and participant settings before the meeting starts.

sub_themes.name: Server or Network Errors Prevent Scheduling
Cannot Find Schedule Button on Mobile Home Screen

themes.name: Need Help Setting Up Recurring Meetings

sub_themes.name: Recurring Meeting Option Missing on Mobile

l3_aspects.name: Personal Meeting ID (PMI)
l3_aspects.description: A static, personal meeting room that is always available. Users can customize their PMI for a permanent, easy-to-remember link, ideal for recurring or ad-hoc meetings without needing to schedule a new one each time.

themes.name: Confusion About PMI vs Unique Meeting ID

sub_themes.name: When to Use PMI vs New Meeting

l3_aspects.name: Alternative Host
l3_aspects.description: The ability to designate another licensed user to start and manage a scheduled meeting if the original host is unavailable.

l3_aspects.name: Join via Link
l3_aspects.description: The process of joining a Zoom meeting by clicking on a meeting link or entering a meeting ID.

l3_aspects.name: Meeting Registration
l3_aspects.description: A feature that requires attendees to register before joining a meeting, allowing hosts to collect information and manage attendance.

l3_aspects.name: Host & Co-Host Controls
l3_aspects.description: The set of permissions and tools available to the meeting host and co-host(s). These controls include managing participants, starting/stopping recordings, and controlling the overall flow of the meeting.

l3_aspects.name: Participant Management
l3_aspects.description: Tools for viewing and managing the list of meeting attendees. Hosts can mute/unmute individuals or all participants, manage video feeds, rename attendees, and control who can enter the meeting.

l3_aspects.name: Breakout Rooms
l3_aspects.description: A feature that allows the host to split a meeting into smaller, separate sessions. This is ideal for small group discussions, workshops, and training, with the ability to assign participants automatically or manually.

l3_aspects.name: In-Meeting Chat
l3_aspects.description: A text-based communication channel available during a meeting. Participants can send messages to everyone, to the host privately, or to other individuals.

l3_aspects.name: Polling & Quizzing
l3_aspects.description: Interactive tools that allow the host to launch single-choice or multiple-choice questions during a meeting or webinar.

l3_aspects.name: AI Meeting Summary
l3_aspects.description: An AI-generated summary of a meeting recording. It automatically identifies key topics, discussion points, and action items.

l3_aspects.name: Audio Enhancement
l3_aspects.description: A collection of settings to improve a user's audio quality, such as background noise suppression.

l3_aspects.name: Join by Phone
l3_aspects.description: The option for participants to dial into a meeting's audio using a standard telephone. This is a critical fallback for users with poor internet connectivity.

l3_aspects.name: HD Video
l3_aspects.description: The capability to transmit and receive video in high definition (720p or 1080p). This provides a clearer, more lifelike visual experience.

l3_aspects.name: Virtual Backgrounds
l3_aspects.description: A feature that allows users to display an image or video as their background during a meeting. This provides privacy and a more professional appearance.

l3_aspects.name: Gallery View
l3_aspects.description: A video layout that displays multiple participants in a grid format, allowing users to see everyone in the meeting at once.

l3_aspects.name: Cloud Recording
l3_aspects.description: The ability to record meetings directly to Zoom's cloud storage, making recordings accessible from anywhere and easy to share.

l3_aspects.name: Local Recording
l3_aspects.description: The ability to record meetings to a local device, providing more control over storage and privacy.

l3_aspects.name: Meeting Transcript
l3_aspects.description: An AI-generated text transcript of the meeting audio, useful for accessibility and searchability.
